lg.l: Anno 1705.
Out of Pliny's Nat: Hist. L.10.C.67. and L.29.C.4.
As Mastive Dogs in Modern Phrase are
Call'd Pompey, Scipio, and Caesar;
As Pyes, and Daws are often stil'd
With Christian Nick-names, like a Child;
As We say Monsieur, to an Ape,
Without Offence to humane Shape;
So Men have got from Bird and Brute
Names that wou'd best their Natures suit:
The Lion, Eagle, and the Bear
Were Heroes Titles heretofore
Bestow'd as Hieroglyphicks fit
T'Express their Valour, Strength or Wit.
For what is understood by Fame
Beside the getting of a Name?
But e'er since Men invented Guns
A diff'rent Way their Fancy runs:
To Paint a Hero, We Enquier
For something that will Conquer Fire.
Would You describe Turenne, or Trump,
Think of a Bucket, or a Pump?
Are these too Low?────then find out Grandeur,
Call My Lord Cutts a Salamander.
'Tis Well.────But since We Live among
Detractors with an Evill Tongue,
Who may Object against the Term,
Pliny shall prove what We affirm:
Pliny shall prove, and We'll apply,
And I'll be Judg'd by Standers-by.First then our Author has defin'd
This Reptil, of the Serpent kind,
With Gawdy Coat, and shining Train,
But Loathsom spots his Body stain:
Out from some hole obscure he flies,
When Rains descend, and Tempests Rise,
'Till the Sun clears the Air; and then
Crawls back neglected to his Den.So when the War has rais'd a Storm
I've seen a Snake in human Form,
All stain'd with Infamy and Vice
Leap from the Dunghill in a Trice
Burnish and make a Gawdy Show,
Become a General, Peer, and Beau,
'Till Peace hath made the Sky Serene
Then shrink into its Hole again.All this We grant──why then Look YonderSure that must be a Salamander!Farther we are by Pliny told,
This Serpent is Extreamly cold,
So cold that put it in the fire
'Twill make the Very Flames Expire.
Besides it spues a filthy Froth,
(Whether thro' Rage, or Love or both)
Of matter purulent and White,
Which hapening on the skin to Light,
And there Corrupting to a Wound,
Spreads Leprosy and Baldness round.So have I seen a Batter'd Beau,
By Age and Claps grown cold as Snow,
Whose Breath, or Touch, where e'er he came,
Blew out Love's Torch, or Chil'd the Flame:
And shou'd some Nymph, who ne'er was Cruel,
Like Carleton Cheap, or Fam'd Duruell,
Receive the Filth which he ejects,
She soon wou'd find the same Effects,
Her tainted Carcase to pursue
As from the Salamander's spue;
A dismal shedding of her Locks
And, if no Leprosy, a Pox.Then I'll appeal to each By-standerWhether this ben't a Salamander?082-002D
